title: Jealous WAG, 31, smashed glass over head of footballer boyfriend Josh Walker
text:
A jealous WAG smashed a glass over her footballer boyfriend's head after she caught him talking to another woman in a nightclub.

Lauren Dinse, 31, lashed out at former Aberdeen hero Josh Walker when she spotted him speaking to a woman at Edinburgh's trendy Lulu club last year.

Mother-of-two Dinse left the midfielder bleeding heavily from a deep gash to his head and he was rushed to hospital for treatment where he received 11 stitches.

Violent Lauren Dinse, 31, lashed out at former Aberdeen hero Josh Walker when she spotted him speaking to a woman at Edinburgh's trendy Lulu club last year. The mother-of-two left the former football ace needing 11 stitches following the violent attack

Dinse left the midfielder (pictured) bleeding heavily from a deep gash to his head and he was rushed to hospital for treatment where he received 11 stitches to the head wound

Dinse, whose two children are with the footballer, pleaded guilty to last December's savage assault when she appeared in the dock at Edinburgh Sheriff Court on Wednesday.

Prosecutor Alistair Millar gave a short narration to the court and said Dinse, of Duddingston, Edinburgh, had been in a relationship with Walker at the time of the assault.

Mr Millar said: 'This incident took place in a nightclub where the accused has witnessed the complainer was speaking to another female.

'Her reaction to this was to hit him over the head with a glass.'

Mr Millar said CCTV of the attack was available but Sheriff Adrian Cottam declined to view the footage as he was content with the narrative.

The fiscal added Mr Walker's injury was described as 'a deep laceration to the head which was five centimetres in length' and which required 11 stitches.

Defending solicitor Chelsea Martin said she would reserve her mitigation to the sentencing diet.

Sheriff Cottam said the assault to severe injury charge would require social work reports and he deferred sentence on Dinse to next month.

Dinse admitted to assaulting Joshua Walker by striking him to the head with a glass to his severe injury at Lulu nightclub, George Street, Edinburgh, on December 9 last year. She has yet to be sentenced.

Walker, 30, has recently retired from the game after suffering years of pain due to a serious knee injury sustained when he was a promising teenager.

The 30-year-old is most known for scoring the opening goal against German giants Bayern Munich in a knock out UEFA Cup match at Pittodrie in 2008.

He also played in the English Premiership for Middlesbrough at just 17 and captained England at the 2009 FIFA U-20 World Cup in Egypt.

His last attempt at glory before giving the game up earlier this year was as captain of Scottish League Two side Edinburgh City who he signed for in 2017.

Walker scored a European wonder goal for Aberdeen against Bayern Munich in a 2-2 draw at Pittodrie while he was just 18 after joining the club on loan from Middlesbrough 11 years ago.

He also played for Watford, Bournemouth, Rotherham and Indian side Bengaluru in an injury hit playing career.

Walker made the decision to quit the game in August this year due to the pain he was suffering from the knee injury and is currently teaching the game to kids at his Foot Forward Coaching business.
description: Lauren Dinse, 31, lashed out at former Aberdeen footballer Josh Walker when she spotted him speaking to a woman at Edinburgh's trendy Lulu club last year.
